notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: The cornerstone of Dania's new building at the corner of Kedzie and Wabansia, was laid Wednesday afternoon during a ceremony attended by a great number of its members.

Mr. P. Christensen, president of Dania and chairman of the building committee, delivered a stirring speech, announcing that a copy of Dania's by-laws and membership list, a copy of the report of its first meeting, on Nov. 23, 1863, together with a copy each of Revyen, The Danish Pioneer, and Chicago-Posten, would be placed in a copper box inside the stone. This was done, whereupon the embryo building received a thundering ovation.
After the ceremony, refreshments were served in P. Nielsen's hall.
